by check mark whether the registrant is a shell company (as defined in Rule&nbsp;126-2
of the Exchange Act). Yes&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font face="Wingdings">o</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; No <font face="Wingdings">&#253;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
aggregate market value of the voting stock held by non-affiliates of the
registrant as of September&nbsp;7, 2005 was $58,548,764 based on the closing
price reported on such date by The NASDAQ Stock Market. Shares of Common Stock
held by officers and directors and by persons who hold 5% or more of the
outstanding Common Stock have been excluded from the calculation of this amount
because such persons may be deemed to be affiliates. This determination of
affiliate status is not necessarily conclusive.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As
of September&nbsp;7<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">, </font></b>2005, the
number of outstanding shares of the registrant&#146;s Common Stock was 14,199,097.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DOCUMENTS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Portions of the Proxy Statement to
be filed in connection with registrant&#146;s Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be
held on November&nbsp;15,&nbsp;2005 (the &#147;Proxy Statement&#148;) are incorporated
herein by reference into Part&nbsp;III of this Report.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&#160; </font></h3>

<div style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 9.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">

<p style="border:none;color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;padding:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;I</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">This
Report contains certain statements of a forward-looking nature relating to
future events or the future performance of our company. Words such as &#147;expects,&#148;
&#147;anticipates,&#148; &#147;intends,&#148; &#147;plans,&#148; &#147;believes,&#148; &#147;seeks,&#148; &#147;estimates&#148; and similar
expressions or variations of such words are intended to identify
forward-looking statements, but are not the only means of identifying
forward-looking statements. Prospective investors are cautioned that such
statements are only predictions and that actual events or results may differ
materially. In evaluating such statements, prospective investors should
specifically consider various factors identified in this Report, including the
matters set forth below under the caption &#147;Risk Factors,&#148; which could cause
actual results to differ materially from those indicated by such
forward-looking statements.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Overland was originally founded and incorporated as
Overland Data,&nbsp;Inc. in California in 1980.&#160;
In June&nbsp;2002, we changed our name to Overland Storage,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; Our principal executive offices are located
at 4820&nbsp;Overland Avenue, San Diego, California 92123, telephone 858-571-5555.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">For 25 years we have delivered data protection solutions
designed for backup and recovery to ensure business continuity.&#160; Historically, we have focused on delivering a
portfolio of tape automation solutions including loader and library systems
designed for small business and midrange computing environments.&#160; Beginning with the June&nbsp;2003 acquisition
</font>of Okapi Software,&nbsp;Inc. (Okapi or Okapi software), a
privately-owned company based in San Diego, California, we expanded our product offerings to include a family of intelligent
disk-based backup and recovery appliances to complement our tape
solutions.&#160; In August&nbsp;2005, we
acquired Zetta Systems, Inc. (Zetta or Zetta Systems), a privately-owned
company based in the Seattle, Washington area, and plan to utilize the Zetta
software as the basis for a new line of protected primary disk-based storage
appliances.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One of the main market differentiators of our products
has been that we design them around a modular, scalable architecture.&#160; This enables customers to purchase storage as
they need it, rather than having to purchase larger monolithic devices with
excess capacity.&#160; Customers can purchase
an initial module to meet their near-term needs, and later increase speed and
capacity by adding modules that can be interconnected to function as a single
system.&#160; This provides a lower price
entry point, investment protection, and an increased level of fault tolerance,
as each module is self-sufficient and will continue to function even if another
were to fail.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also differentiate ourselves with our &#147;go-to-market&#148;
approach.&#160; We are the only supplier in
our market space that has a completely indirect sales model.&#160; We do not have a direct sales force.&#160; The majority of our sales have historically
been generated through private label arrangements with original equipment
manufacturers (OEMs).&#160; The remainder of
our sales are made through commercial distributors, direct market retailers
(DMRs or catalogers) and value-added resellers (VARs).</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">End-users of our products include small and midsize
businesses, as well as divisions and operating units of large multi-national
corporations, governmental organizations, universities and other non-profit
institutions.&#160; Our products are used in a
broad range of industry sectors including financial services, healthcare,
retail, manufacturing, telecommunications, broadcasting, research and development
and many others.&#160; Our products are sold
world-wide in the Americas, EMEA (Europe, Middle East, Africa) and Asia
Pacific.&#160; Approximately 58.8% of our
revenues are generated internationally, primarily in Europe.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Internet address is www.overlandstorage.com.&#160; We make available free of charge on our
Internet website our annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K, quarterly reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q,
current reports on Form&nbsp;8-K, and amendments to those reports filed
pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(a)&nbsp;or 15(d)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange
Act as soon as reasonably practicable after we electronically file such
material with, or furnish it to, the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160; The contents of our website are not a part of
this Report.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Direction and
Strategy</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our strategy is to become a market leader and innovative
supplier of a complete portfolio of tiered data storage solutions by providing
intelligent appliances and software modules designed to work together to ensure
that information is &#147;automatically safe, readily available and always there.&#148;&#160; We intend to deliver products to address all
three tiers of data storage:&#160; primary &#147;protected&#148;
disk, secondary disk-based backup and tertiary automated tape libraries for
archival.&#160; Our focus will continue to be
on mid-range solutions that can be easily sold worldwide through our indirect
network of resellers.&#160; We intend to
leverage our leadership position in mid-range tape automation into a similar
position in primary and secondary intelligent disk-based appliances.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Historically, magnetic tape has been used for all forms
of data backup and recovery.&#160; This is
because tape was, and still is, the only reliable, &#147;removable&#148;, high capacity
storage media that can be taken off-site to ensure that data is safeguarded in
case of disaster.&#160; For a number of years
now, Overland has held a market-leading position in mid-range tape automation,
and sales of tape automation appliances have represented more than 90% of our
revenue for each of the last three fiscal years.&#160; In order to protect our position, in the
fourth quarter of fiscal 2005 we commenced development of a new tape automation
platform that we expect will spawn several new price competitive products.&#160; These products will be delivered to market in
the second half of fiscal 2006.&#160; Although
we expect that tape solutions will continue to be the anchor of the data
protection strategy at most companies, tape backup is time consuming and often
unreliable and inefficient.&#160; The process
of recovering data from tape is also time consuming and inefficient.&#160; Ultimately, we expect that tape will likely
be relegated to an archival role for infrequently accessed data.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Over the last couple of years, the
advent of low-cost serial ATA disk and iSCSI networking technology, together
with greatly increased regulatory compliance requirements and the continued
growth of digital data, have driven businesses to use secondary storage
disk-based backup appliances.&#160; One of the
greatest benefits of disk-based backup is the speed of restoration.&#160; Studies show that approximately 90% of
recovered data is two weeks old or younger, or last accessed within that
period.&#160; As a result, many IT managers
are electing to use disk-based appliances as an intermediate staging area, with
the backup data eventually moving to tape.&#160;
We have enjoyed initial success in this relatively new market space, and
we believe there is significant promise for future growth.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to daily or periodic
backup, companies are also looking for ways to protect their data continuously.
&#160;Software protection is being applied to
primary storage devices through a combination of features including file and
block-based replication, near instantaneous snapshotting, virtualization and
thin provisioning.&#160; We intend to use the
software technology developed by Zetta Systems, which we acquired in August
2005, as the basis for a line of protected primary storage appliances to be
introduced in the second fiscal quarter of our fiscal&#160; 2006.&#160;
This product line will be marketed and sold through our existing branded
sales channel.&#160; It will be targeted to
the mid-market with a goal of delivering enterprise-class availability,
built-in data protection and exceptional performance at an affordable price.&#160; The primary storage market is currently many
times larger than the secondary and tertiary storage markets, and we anticipate
that the primary storage market will be the source of much of our long term
revenue growth.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Success in the primary and secondary
disk-based appliance markets will require us to introduce a steady stream of
new products that are feature-rich and competitively priced.&#160; Therefore, we must significantly enhance our
software development team and commit additional sales and marketing resources
to promote and sell the products.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Products</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our current products and other offerings include:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Tape Automation</font></i> - Automated tape libraries are devices
capable of managing multiple data cartridges and incorporate two or more tape
drives to provide unattended backup of large quantities of data.&#160; Our libraries incorporate tape drives
supplied by other manufacturers based on the leading mid-range tape
technologies, including LTO (Linear Tape Open) and DLTtape.&#160; We currently offer the following tape
automation products:</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Scalable NEO SERIES<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b></font></i> &#150; We offer 3 versions of our NEO product
family:</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font>&nbsp;NEO 2000 can accommodate up to 2 tape drives
and 30 cartridges and can scale up to 8 modules high with 16 tape drives and
240 cartridges.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149; </font>NEO 4000 can accommodate up to 4 tape drives
and 60 cartridges and can scale up to 4 modules high to comprise a system of 16
tape drives and 240 cartridges.&#160;
Customers can configure NEO systems with a combination of NEO 2000 and
4000 modules.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149; </font>NEO 8000 consists of a base model
with 100-cartridge capacity which can be scaled up to 500 cartridges through a
field-enabled software key.&#160;
Additionally, two NEO 8000s can be interconnected to provide up to 1,000
cartridge capacity.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">PowerLoaders</font></i><b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;"> and Loaders</font></i> &#150;
Made for smaller environments that do not require scalability, we offer both
power loaders with one or two tape drives, and loaders with only a single tape
drive.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Disk-based Products</font></i>
&#150; In August&nbsp;2003, we began shipping our REO SERIES<sup>TM</sup> of
disk-based products based on the technology we received in the Okapi Software
acquisition.&#160; The REO product family
currently consists of three products:</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>REO 1000 with 4 disk drives and a
native capacity of 1.6&nbsp;terabytes;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>REO 4000 with 8 disk drives and a
native capacity of 3.2 terabytes; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>REO 9000 with 12 or 24 disk drives
and a native capacity of up to 9.6 terabytes.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
strength of these intelligent appliances lies in the embedded Protection OS<sup>TM</sup>
software which enables them to be configured as virtual tape libraries, dynamic
virtual tape drives and/or disk LUN volumes.&#160;
The optional REO Multi-Site PAC<sup>TM</sup> software is also available
to protect remote data by facilitating the transfer of data in virtual tape
format from a remote REO to a central REO for management and tape storage.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Related Products and
Services</font></i>&#150; We have a variety of products and services supporting our
tape libraries, PowerLoaders and loaders.&#160;
We currently offer the following additional products and services:</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Desktop and internal upgrade tape
drives.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Spares and post warranty
return-to-factory and on-site service.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Media, including tape cartridges for
SDLT and LTO formats.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">VR<sup>2</sup></font></i><b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;"> </font></i>(Variable Rate
Randomizer) &#150; VR<sup>2</sup><i><font style="font-style:italic;"> </font></i>is our
patented data<sup>  </sup>encoding technology.&#160;
This technology, which is embedded in an Applications Specific
Integrated Circuit (ASIC) chip, is capable of significantly increasing the
native capacity and data transfer rate performance of linear tape technologies
without requiring any changes in tape path design, recording heads and/or
media.&#160; This performance is accomplished
by achieving encoding efficiency of greater than 99%.&#160; We have licensed VR<sup>2 </sup>to Tandberg
Data ASA for use in its Scalable Linear Recording (SLR) tape drives, to Imation
Corporation as the owner of the Travan technology format, to Quantum, formerly
Certance, for use in its Travan tape drive offerings, and to Storage Technology
Corporation (StorageTek) for use in its T9940 and T9840 drives and future tape
drive products.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Customers</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating structure is optimized for our mid-range
strategy in that our products do not require us to have a &#147;direct&#148; (to
end-users) sales or service force.&#160; </font>We
sell all our products on an indirect basis, primarily through three channels or
types of customers: (i)&nbsp;OEMs; (ii)&nbsp;distributors; and (iii)&nbsp;VARs.&#160; Regardless of the channel through which they
are sold, all of our products are designed and manufactured to meet OEM-level
requirements and reliability standards.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">OEM Channel</font></i></b>
- - Our significant OEM supply agreements have been with Hewlett Packard Company
(HP) and International Business Machine Corporation (IBM), both of which
incorporate our NEO products into their system offerings.&#160; Fujitsu and NEC also purchase NEO products
and sell them under their respective labels.&#160;
However, we are required to sell to them through their appointed
reseller, and consequently we classify them as VAR customers rather than OEM
customers.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;2005,
we announced that HP had selected an alternate supplier for its next-generation
mid-range tape automation product.&#160; We
expect HP to begin purchasing the first product of this new line from the
alternate supplier during calendar year 2006.&#160;
Although HP will continue to purchase the tape automation products
currently supplied by Overland for some time, the new product will eventually
replace the majority of those purchases. We cannot predict how quickly this
transition will occur, but believe the impact to our revenue in fiscal 2006
will be minimal. The impact in fiscal 2007 is expected to be significant.&#160; In light of this anticipated loss in future
revenue, we intend to focus heavily on the delivery of new products through our
higher-margin branded channel.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although
we continually strive to win new OEM business, the OEM sales cycle is often
lengthy and uncertain.&#160; It typically consists
of a general technology evaluation, qualification of product specifications,
verification of product performance against these specifications, integration
testing of the product within the customers&#146; systems, product announcement and
volume shipment.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As is
customary in the industry, our OEM contracts have a three year term, provide
for periodic price reviews and the customers are not required to purchase
minimum quantities.&#160; Our existing
contracts with HP (dated August&nbsp;2003) and IBM (dated November&nbsp;2002)
also provide that title to inventory shipped from our warehouse into various
inventory hub locations remains with us until the products are shipped to their
customers.&#160; HP, including the former
Compaq that HP acquired in May&nbsp;2002, has been our largest customer,
accounting for approximately 54.3%, 58.8% and 58.4% of sales in fiscal 2005,
2004 and 2003, respectively.&#160; No other
customer accounted for more than 10% of sales in any year during the three-year
period.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Distribution Channel</font></i></b>
- - Our primary distribution customers include Bell Microproducts,&nbsp;Inc.,
Ingram Micro,&nbsp;Inc. and Tech Data Corporation in the United States and
approximately eight technical distributors in Europe.&#160; Typically, these distributors sell our
products to smaller VARs and catalogers who in turn sell to end-users.&#160; The distribution agreements include
provisions for rights of return, stock rotation and price protection, common
terms in the commercial distribution area.&#160;
Because of these terms, revenue from shipments to these customers is not
recognized until the related products are in turn sold by the distributor.&#160; We support these distributors through a
dedicated field sales force and provide further support through field sales
personnel who work with the smaller VARs and catalogers to generate end-user
sales and create the pull through its distribution customers.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">VAR Channel</font></i></b>
- - Our VAR channel includes systems integrators and larger VARs who qualify to
purchase direct from Overland.&#160; Some of
these customers specialize in the insurance, banking, financial, geophysical or
medical industries, and offer a variety of value-added services relating to our
products.&#160; Our products frequently are
packaged by these customers as part of a complete data processing system or
combined with other storage devices, such as redundant array of independent
disks (RAID) systems, to deliver a complete storage subsystem.&#160; These customers also recommend our products
as replacement solutions when backup systems are upgraded, and bundle our
products with storage management software specific to the end-user&#146;s
system.&#160; We support this channel through
our field sales representatives.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our products are sold
both domestically and internationally and we have sales personnel located in
various cities throughout the world.&#160; We
divide our sales into three geographical regions: (1)&nbsp;the Americas,
consisting of North and South America; (2)&nbsp;Europe, Middle East and Africa
(EMEA); and (3)&nbsp;Asia Pacific (APAC).&#160;
Primary support for customers in the Americas is provided from our San
Diego headquarters office.&#160; EMEA is
supported by our wholly-owned subsidiaries located in Wokingham, England;
Paris, France; and Munich, Germany.&#160; The
subsidiary in England provides sales, technical support and repair services,
while the subsidiaries in France and Germany provide sales and technical
support.&#160; Our APAC customers are
supported by our sales office in Singapore and Korea.&#160; We assign to our international distributors
the right to sell our products in a country or group of countries.&#160; In addition, many domestic customers ship a
portion of our products to their overseas customers.&#160; Our foreign sales for fiscal years 2005, 2004
and 2003 were approximately $138.5 million, $116.5 million and $85.1 million,
respectively, representing 58.8%, 48.9% and 43.4%, respectively, of our total
net revenues. Foreign sales in the United Kingdom and Singapore, primarily in
our OEM channel, were approximately $65.8 million and $21.8 million,
respectively in fiscal 2005, $67.2 million and $9.4 million, respectively, in
fiscal 2004 and $52.2 million and $2.7 million, respectively in fiscal 2003.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our marketing efforts include
support for both our OEM and branded customers.&#160;
Our branded channel partners are provided with a full range of marketing
materials, including product specification literature, software connectivity
information and application notes.&#160; Our
sales management and engineering personnel provide support to the channel
partners and, in certain instances, visit potential customer sites to explain
and demonstrate the technical advantages of our products.&#160; We maintain press relations both domestically
and in Europe, and participate in national and regional trade shows in varying
degrees both domestically and internationally.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales to customers outside of the U.S. represent a
significant portion of our sales.&#160;
International sales are subject to various risks and uncertainties.&#160; See &#147;Our international operations are
important to our business and involve unique risks&#148; in Risk Factors below.&#160; Sales generated by our European channel
generally show seasonal slowing during our first fiscal quarter (July&nbsp;through
September), reflecting the summer holiday period in Europe.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Customer
Service and Support</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
technical support personnel are trained on our products and assist customers
with &#147;plug-and-play&#148; compatibility between multiple hardware platforms,
operating systems and backup, data interchange and storage management
software.&#160; Our application engineers are
available to solve more complex customer problems and visit customer sites when
necessary.&#160; Customers that need service
and support can contact us through our toll-free telephone lines, facsimile and
Internet e-mail.&#160; Application notes and
user manuals can be obtained directly from our website.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We generally provide a three-year advance replacement
return-to-factory warranty on our NEO SERIES, PowerLoader and LoaderXpress
products and a one year advance replacement return-to-factory warranty on our
REO SERIES.&#160; We also provide on-site
service for the first warranty year of the NEO SERIES products for which we
contract with third-party service providers.&#160;
For most products, we offer a program called XchangeNOW as part of our
return-to-factory warranty that enables customers to receive an advance
replacement unit shipped within two business days after placing a service
request.&#160; Our customer ships the
defective unit back to us using the shipping materials from the replacement
unit.&#160; Separately priced on-site
warranties are offered for sale to customers of other product lines.&#160; We contract with outside vendors to provide
service relating to all on-site warranties.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Research
and Development</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">We incurred research and development (R&amp;D) costs of
$10.7 million,&#160; $7.3 million and $7.4
million in fiscal years 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively, representing 4.5%,
3.0% and 3.8% of net revenues, respectively.&#160;
</font>We currently employ 69 people
in our R&amp;D department, including electrical, mechanical and firmware
engineers who support our tape automation business and software engineers who
support our REO disk-based appliance products.&#160;
In fiscal 2006 our development efforts will focus on four projects: (1)&nbsp;a
new tape automation platform that we anticipate will spawn several new products
targeting the price conscious small and medium business market; (2)&nbsp;a new
protected primary storage appliance based on the software we received in the August&nbsp;2005
acquisition of Zetta Systems; (3)&nbsp;the addition of scalability to our
current line of REO disk based backup and recovery appliances; and (4)&nbsp;software
for interoperability of all of our tiered storage products.&#160; We expect these projects will increase
R&amp;D expenditures as a percent of net revenues to greater than 7.0% in
fiscal 2006.&#160; Development of the tape
automation platform has passed the prototype phase and we expect initial
customer shipments to begin in the third quarter of fiscal 2006.&#160; Development of both the new protected primary
storage appliance and REO scalability will soon be in beta testing with first
customer shipments expected in the second quarter of fiscal 2006.&#160; Development of software interoperability of
all our tiered storage products is still in the early research stage.&#160; We currently have no customer-sponsored
R&amp;D activities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, our level of R&amp;D spending is dependent
upon our product development cycles.&#160;
During the later stages of the cycles, including the building of alpha
and beta units and design verification testing, significant amounts of
development materials are consumed.&#160; OEM
customers also generally require evaluation units to qualify a new design.&#160; We anticipate that our move into primary
storage will require a higher level of R&amp;D spending in order for us to be
competitive and successful in this new market.&#160;
Despite our R&amp;D efforts, we may not be able to identify, develop,
manufacture, market or support new or enhanced products successfully or on a
timely basis and any new products may not gain market acceptance.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Manufacturing and
Suppliers</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Historically, we have maintained a fully integrated
factory in San Diego, California.&#160;
However, in September&nbsp;2004, in order to reduce our cost structure,
increase our flexibility and improve our focus on product development, we
announced plans to outsource all of our manufacturing to Sanmina-SCI
Corporation (Sanmina).&#160; The transition of
manufacturing of all of our products to Sanmina was completed in August&nbsp;2005.&#160; Currently, all of our products are produced
by Sanmina at their Rapid City, South Dakota plant.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We purchase completed products from Sanmina.&#160; They are generally responsible for procuring
all raw materials and producing the products to meet our specifications.&#160; However, we currently purchase tape drives and
certain printed circuit boards (PCBs) which are incorporated into our tape
automation products and consign the drives and PCBs to Sanmina.&#160; Tape drives are the most expensive material
component of these products and consignment enables us to avoid an additional
markup from Sanmina.&#160; For certain tape
drives, we qualify only a single source, which can magnify the risk of
shortages and decrease our ability to negotiate with our suppliers on the basis
of price.&#160; From time to time in the past, we have not
obtained as many drives as we have needed from various vendors due to drive
shortages or quality issues.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, Overland-branded products are not
manufactured until an order is received.&#160;
The typical lead-time for manufacturing products is three to five days
and backlog is generally not a significant factor to our business.&#160; Our two largest OEM customers, HP and IBM,
have both required that we maintain inventory on hand, known as buffer stock,
at any given time sufficient to supply their forecasted requirements for the
next three weeks.&#160; They provide weekly
forecast information that allows us to manage both raw material and finished
goods inventories.&#160; The buffer stock is
shipped into various distribution hubs around the world and we retain ownership
of that inventory until it is pulled by HP and IBM to fulfill customer orders,
at which time we record the sale.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Competition</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The worldwide storage market is intensely competitive
and barriers to entry are relatively low. However, no significant new entry has
occurred in several years.&#160; Our
competitors vary in size from small start-ups to large multi-national
corporations who have substantially greater financial, R&amp;D and marketing
resources.&#160; In the tape automation market,
our primary competition includes Advanced Digital Information Corporation and
Quantum Corporation with limited competition from Storage Technology
Corporation (recently acquired by Sun Microsystems,&nbsp;Inc.) in larger scale
libraries. &#160;Key competitive factors
include product features, reliability, durability, scalability and price.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our disk-based products currently compete with products
made by Quantum Corporation, Advanced Digital Information Corporation, Storage
Technology Corporation, EMC Corporation, Network Appliance,&nbsp;Inc. and
numerous small startups.&#160; We believe
additional competitors are likely to enter the market.&#160;&#160; Key competitive factors in these markets
include performance, functionality, scalability, availability,
interoperability, connectivity, time to market enhancements and total value of
ownership.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The markets for all of our products are characterized by
significant price competition, and we anticipate that our products will face
increasing price pressure.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Proprietary
Rights</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General &#150; </font></b><font style="font-weight:normal;">In the tape automation space, we believe that
patent, copyright, trademark and trade secret protection are less significant
than factors such as the knowledge, ability and experience of our personnel,
new product introductions and product enhancements.&#160; In the secondary disk-based appliance and
primary protected storage spaces, we believe intellectual property protection
will be an important competitive advantage, and we intend to secure a
significant number of patents, copyrights and trademarks as quickly as possible
to obtain a leadership position in these areas.</font></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">We presently hold 17</font></b>
<font style="font-weight:normal;">United</font><font style="font-weight:normal;"> States patents and have </font><font style="font-weight:normal;">6</font>  <font style="font-weight:normal;">United States patents pending. In general, these patents have a 20-year
term from the first effective filing date for each patent. We also hold a
number of foreign patents and patent applications for certain of our products
and technologies.&#160; These</font><font style="font-weight:normal;"> rights, however, may not prevent competitors from
developing substantially equivalent or superior products to ours.&#160; In addition, our present and future patents
may be challenged, invalidated or circumvented, reducing or eliminating our
proprietary protection.</font></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">VR<sup>2</sup>
Technology</font></b> &#150; We have entered into various intellectual
property licensing agreements relating to our VR<sup>2</sup> technology.&#160; These agreements require the payment of
royalty fees based on sales by licensees of products containing VR<sup>2</sup>.&#160; In certain instances, we sell to the licensee
ASIC chips embodying VR<sup>2 </sup>priced to include the cost of the chip plus
an embedded royalty fee.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employees</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of June&nbsp;30,
2005, we had 335 employees, including 133 in sales and marketing, 61 in
research and development, 89 in manufacturing and operations and 52 in finance,
information systems, human resources and other management.&#160; There are no collective bargaining contracts
covering any of the employees and we believe that our relationship with our
employees is good.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>
