<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RISK FACTORS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">An investment in our company involves
a high degree of risk.&#160; In addition to
the other information included in this Report, you should carefully consider
the following risk factors in evaluating an investment in our company.&#160; You should consider these matters in
conjunction with the other information included or incorporated by reference in
this Report.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our business has been highly
dependent on our level of sales to one major customer, and such customer will
not be purchasing our next generation product</font></b><i><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;">.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Hewlett-Packard
Company (HP), including the former Compaq which HP acquired in May&nbsp;2002,
has been our largest customer, accounting for approximately 54.3% of net
revenues in fiscal 2005, 58.8% of net revenues in fiscal 2004 and 58.4% of net
revenues in fiscal 2003.&#160; No other
customer accounted for more than 10% of net revenues in fiscal 2005.&#160; Neither HP nor any other customer is
obligated to purchase a specific amount of our products or provide binding
forecasts of purchases for any period.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;2005, we announced that HP had selected
an alternate supplier for its next-generation mid-range tape automation
product.&#160; We expect HP to begin
purchasing the first product of this new line from the alternate supplier
during calendar year 2006.&#160; We expect HP
to continue to purchase the tape automation products currently supplied by us
for some time, but the new product will eventually replace the majority of
those purchases. We cannot predict how quickly this transition will occur, but
we believe the impact to our revenue during fiscal 2007 will be significant and
there may be some impact to revenue in fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">In
August&nbsp;2005, we acquired Zetta Systems, Inc. and the failure to
successfully integrate this acquisition, or others in the future, could harm
our business, financial condition and operating results.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have in the past and expect in the future to make acquisitions of complementary
businesses, products or technologies as we implement our business
strategy.&#160; For example, in June&nbsp;2003
we acquired Okapi Software, Inc. and in August&nbsp;2005 we acquired Zetta
Systems.&#160; We are working now to integrate
Zetta and to introduce products based on the Zetta software.&#160; If we fail to integrate Zetta successfully,
it could harm our business, financial condition and operating results.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Mergers
and acquisitions involve numerous risks, including liabilities that we may
assume from the acquired company, difficulties in the assimilation of the
operations and personnel of the acquired business, the diversion of management&#146;s
attention from other business concerns, risks of entering markets in which we
have no direct prior experience, and the potential loss of key employees of the
acquired business.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Future
mergers and acquisitions by us also may result in dilutive issuances of our
equity securities and the incurrence of additional debt and amortization
expenses related to intangible assets.&#160;
Any of these factors could adversely affect our business, liquidity,
results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">We
have outsourced all of our manufacturing to Sanmina-SCI Corporation.&#160; If we are unable to obtain our products from
Sanmina-SCI in a cost effective and timely manner that meets our customers&#146;
expectations, such failure could materially and adversely impact our business,
financial condition and results of operations.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;2005,
we completed the outsourcing of all our manufacturing to Sanmina-SCI
Corporation.&#160; We face a number of risks
as a result of our decision to outsource manufacturing to Sanmina.&#160; Sanmina will be the sole source supplier for
all of our products.&#160; Because of this
dependence on one supplier, we are at greater risk of experiencing shortages or
other delays in customer deliveries which could result in customer
dissatisfaction and lost sales.&#160; We will
also be dependent on Sanmina for product quality, over which we will have
limited control.&#160; Our agreement with
Sanmina also commits us to purchase products and materials based upon a
forecast of customer demand that we provide.&#160;
In the event of a reduction or shift in product mix in the forecast, we
would be obligated to purchase finished goods in excess of customer demand, or
be required to reimburse Sanmina for unique parts or excess or obsolete
inventory.&#160; As a result, we could
experience reduced gross margins based on these purchase commitments.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our new
disk-based products involve many significant risks.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;2003,
we began shipping our REO SERIES of secondary disk-based backup and recovery
products based on technology acquired from Okapi Software,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; We also expect to introduce a disk-based
protected primary storage product in October&nbsp;2005 based on the technology
acquired from Zetta Systems,&nbsp;Inc.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
success of these disk-based products is uncertain and subject to significant
risks, any of which could have a material adverse effect on our business,
liquidity, results of operation and financial position.&#160; We must commit significant resources to these
new products before determining whether they will succeed.&#160; If these new products are not adopted by
customers or do not achieve anticipated sales levels, any related intangible
assets we have recorded may be impaired.&#160;
Such impairment would result in a charge against earnings in the period
for which impairment is determined to exist, and reduce our assets and shareholders&#146;
equity.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior
to our acquisition of Okapi Software, we had not been involved in the
development, marketing and sale of disk-based products, and prior to our
acquisition of Zetta Systems, we had not been involved in the protected primary
storage market.&#160; The protected primary
storage area is still new to many of our personnel.&#160; We will need to continuously update and
periodically upgrade these products to stay competitive.&#160; Any delay in the commercial release of new or
enhanced disk-based products could result in a significant loss of potential
revenues and may adversely impact the market price of our common stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If our
disk-based products do not achieve market acceptance or success, then the
association of our brand name with these products may adversely affect our
reputation and our sales of other products, as well as dilute the value of our
brand name.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The market price
of our common stock may be volatile</font></b><i><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;">.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The
market price of our common stock has experienced significant fluctuations since
it commenced trading in February&nbsp;1997.&#160;
The market price of our common stock may continue to fluctuate
significantly in the future.&#160; Many
factors could cause the market price of our common stock to fluctuate,
including:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">announcements concerning us, our competitors, our customers or our
industry;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in earnings estimates by analysts;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">purchasing decisions of HP and other significant customers;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">quarterly variations in operating results;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the introduction of new technologies or products;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in product pricing policies by us or our competitors; and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in general economic conditions.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, stock markets have experienced extreme price and volume volatility in
recent years.&#160; This volatility has had a
substantial effect on the market prices of securities of many smaller public
companies for reasons frequently unrelated or disproportionate to the operating
performance of the specific companies.&#160;
These market fluctuations may adversely affect the market price of our
common stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our financial results may
fluctuate substantially for many reasons, and past results should not be relied
on as indications of future performance.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">All
of the markets that we serve are volatile and subject to market shifts, which
we may not be able to discern in advance. A slowdown in the demand for
workstations, mid-range computer systems, networks and servers could have a
significant adverse effect on the demand for our products in any given
period.&#160; We have experienced delays in
receipt of purchase orders and, on occasion, anticipated purchase orders have
been rescheduled or have not materialized due to changes in customer
requirements.&#160; Our customers may cancel
or delay purchase orders for a variety of reasons, including the rescheduling
of new product introductions, changes in their inventory practices or
forecasted demand, general economic conditions affecting our customers&#146;
markets, changes in our pricing or the pricing of our competitors, new product
announcements by us or others, quality or reliability problems related to our
products or selection of competitive products as alternate sources of
supply.&#160; In particular, our ability to
forecast sales to distributors, integrators and value-added resellers is
especially limited as these customers typically provide to us relatively short
order lead times or are permitted to change orders on short notice.&#160; Given that a large portion of our sales are
generated by our European channel, our first fiscal quarter (July&nbsp;through
September) is commonly impacted by seasonally slow European orders, reflecting
the summer holiday period in Europe.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, our financial results have fluctuated and will continue to fluctuate
quarterly and annually based on many other factors such as:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in customer mix (e.g., OEM vs. branded);</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in product mix;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">fluctuations in average selling prices;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">currency exchange fluctuations;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">increases in costs and expenses associated with the introduction of new
products; and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">increases in the cost of or limitations on availability of materials.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Based
on all of the foregoing, we believe that our revenues and operating results
will continue to fluctuate, and period-to-period comparisons are not
necessarily meaningful and should not be relied on as indications of future
performance.&#160; Furthermore, in some future
quarters, our revenues and operating results could be below the expectations of
public market analysts or investors, which could result in a material adverse
effect on the price of our common stock.&#160;
In addition, portions of our expenses are fixed and difficult to reduce
if revenues do not meet our expectations.&#160;
These fixed expenses magnify the material adverse effect of any revenue
shortfall.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">We face intense competition and
price pressure, and many of our competitors have substantially greater
resources than we do.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman"><font style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The
worldwide storage market is intensely competitive as a number of manufacturers
of tape automation solutions and storage management software products compete
for a limited number of customers.&#160; In
addition, barriers to entry are relatively low in these markets.&#160; We currently participate in the mid-range of
the tape backup market.&#160; In this segment,
some of our competitors have substantially greater financial and other
resources, larger research and development staffs, and more experience and
capabilities in manufacturing, marketing and distributing products.&#160; Our hardware products currently compete with
products made by Advanced Digital Information Corporation, Quantum Corporation
and Storage Technology Corporation (recently acquired by Sun
Microsystems).&#160; </font>Our disk-based products currently compete with
products made by International Business Machines Corporation, HP, Computer
Associates International,&nbsp;Inc., EMC Corporation, Veritas Software
Corporation, Quantum Corporation, Network Appliance,&nbsp;Inc. and numerous
small startups.&#160; The markets for our products
are characterized by significant price competition, and we anticipate that our
products will face increasing price pressure.&#160;
This pressure could result in significant price erosion, reduced profit
margins and loss of market share, any of which could have a material adverse
effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our business is highly dependent
on the continued availability and market acceptance of the tape technologies
incorporated in our products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We
have historically derived a majority of our revenue from products that
incorporate tape drives purchased from other manufacturers and based on unique
formats and tape technologies.&#160; Certain
of these tape drives are available only from a single manufacturer.&#160; For the foreseeable future, we expect to
continue to derive a substantial amount of our revenue from products
incorporating these tape drives.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">A
portion of our products incorporate DLTtape drives manufactured by Quantum
Corporation.&#160; Quantum also is one of our
competitors because Quantum markets its own tape automation products.&#160; We do not have a long-term contract with
Quantum, which could cease supplying tape drives directly to us.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, from time to time in the past, we have not obtained as many drives as
we have needed from various vendors due to drive shortages or quality
issues.&#160; Any prolonged inability to
obtain adequate deliveries could require us to pay more for components, parts
and other supplies, seek alternative sources of supply, delay shipment of
products and damage relationships with current and prospective customers.&#160; This type of delay or damage could have a
material adverse effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and
financial position.&#160; In fiscal 1997, we
experienced problems with the supply of a newly-introduced tape drive and these
problems materially adversely affected our sales and earnings for that year.&#160; And, in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2005, we
experienced drive availability issues which had a lesser effect on sales and
earnings for the quarter.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We cannot assure you that
these or similar problems will not reoccur, or that we will not experience
similar or more serious disruptions in supply in the future with current or new
versions of tape drives.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our
future operating results depend on the continued availability and market
acceptance of the current tape technologies that we use.&#160; If tape drives incorporating other
technologies gain comparable or superior market acceptance than those currently
incorporated in our products, we might have to modify the design of our tape
automation products to incorporate these tape drives.&#160; Our inability to do so or to obtain
sufficient quantities of these tape drives could have a material adverse effect
on our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our tape-based storage solutions
compete indirectly with other storage technologies, such as hard disk drives,
and may face competition in the future from other emerging technologies.&#160; The prices of hard disk drives continue to
decrease while capacity and performance have increased.&#160; We expect that our tape-based products will
face increased competition from these alternative technologies.&#160; If our strategy to compete in disk-based
markets does not succeed, our business, financial condition and operating
results will be materially and adversely affected.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our success depends on our
ability to anticipate rapid technological changes and develop new and enhanced
products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">As
an advanced technology company, we are subject to numerous risks and
uncertainties, generally characterized by rapid technological change and
intense competition.&#160; In this
environment, our future success will depend on our ability to anticipate
changes in technology, to develop new and enhanced products on a timely and
cost-effective basis and to introduce, manufacture and achieve market
acceptance of these new and enhanced products.&#160;
Development schedules for high technology products are inherently
subject to uncertainty.&#160; We may not meet
our product development schedules, including those for products based on our
disk-based technology, and development costs could exceed budgeted
amounts.&#160; In addition, there can be no
assurance that the licensees of our VR<sup>2 </sup>technology will meet their
product development schedules.&#160; Our
business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position may be
materially and adversely affected if the products or product enhancements that
we develop are delayed or not delivered due to developmental problems, quality
issues or component shortage problems, or if our products or product
enhancements do not achieve market acceptance or are unreliable.&#160; The introduction, whether by us or our
competitors, of new products embodying new technologies, such as new sequential
or random access mass storage devices, and the emergence of new industry
standards could render existing products obsolete or not marketable, which may
have a material adverse effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation
and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our international operations are
important to our business and involve unique risks.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Historically,
sales to customers outside of the U.S. have represented a significant portion
of our sales and we expect them to continue representing a significant portion
of sales.&#160; Sales to customers outside the
U.S. are subject to various risks, including:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the imposition of governmental controls mandating compliance with
various foreign and U.S. export laws;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">currency exchange fluctuations;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">political and economic instability;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">trade restrictions;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in tariffs and taxes;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">longer payment cycles (typically associated with international sales);
and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">difficulties in staffing and managing international operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Furthermore,
we cannot assure that we will be able to comply with changes in foreign
standards in the future, even though we endeavor to meet standards established
by foreign regulatory bodies.&#160; Our
inability to design products that comply with foreign standards could have a
material adverse effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and
financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">We are
subject to exchange rate risk in connection with our international operations.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not currently engage in foreign currency hedging
activities and therefore we are exposed to some level of currency risk. As
foreign currency exchange rates vary, the fluctuations in revenues and expenses
may materially impact the financial statements upon consolidation.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A weaker U.S. dollar
would result in an increase to revenues and expenses upon consolidation, and a
stronger U.S. dollar would result in a decrease to revenues and expenses upon
consolidation.&#160; Currently, nearly all of
our international sales are denominated in U.S. dollars.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Furthermore, the results of operations of our foreign
subsidiaries are exposed to foreign exchange rate fluctuations as the financial
results of the subsidiaries are translated from the local currency to U.S.
dollars upon consolidation.&#160; Because of
the significance of the operations of our subsidiaries to our consolidated
operations, as exchange rates vary, net sales and other operating results, when
translated, may differ materially from our prior performance and our
expectations. In addition, because of the significance of our overseas
operations, we could also be significantly affected by weak economic conditions
in foreign markets that could reduce demand for our products and further
negatively impact the results of our operations in a material and adverse
manner.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our ability to
compete effectively depends in part on our ability to protect effectively our
intellectual property rights.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman"><font style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We
rely on a combination of patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret and other
intellectual property laws to protect our intellectual property rights.&#160; These rights, however, may not prevent
competitors from developing products that are substantially equivalent or
superior to our products.</font> To the extent we have or obtain patents, such
patents may not afford meaningful protection for our technology and products.
Others may challenge our patents and, as a result, our patents could be
narrowed, invalidated or declared unenforceable. In addition, current or future
patent applications may not result in the issuance of patents in the United
States or foreign countries.&#160; The laws of certain foreign
countries may not protect our intellectual property to the same extent as U.S.
laws.&#160; Furthermore, competitors may
independently develop similar products, duplicate our products or, if patents
are issued to us, design around these patents.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
order to protect or enforce our patent rights, we may initiate interference
proceedings, oppositions, or patent litigation against third parties, such as
infringement suits. These lawsuits could be expensive, take significant time
and divert management&#146;s attention from other business concerns. The patent
position of information technology firms generally is highly uncertain,
involves complex legal and factual questions, and has recently been the subject
of much litigation. No consistent policy has emerged from the U.S. Patent and Trademark
Office or the courts regarding the breadth of claims allowed or the degree of
protection afforded under information technology patents.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our success will depend partly on our
ability to operate without infringing on or misappropriating the proprietary
rights of others.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
business is such that we may at any time be sued for infringing the patent
rights or misappropriating the proprietary rights of others. For example, during
fiscal 2004 we settled a case alleging patent infringement.&#160; Intellectual property litigation is costly
and, even if we prevail, the cost of such litigation could adversely affect our
business, financial condition and results of operations. In addition,
litigation is time consuming and could divert management attention and resources
away from our business. If we do not prevail in any litigation, we could be
required to stop the infringing activity and/or pay substantial damages. Under
some circumstances in the United States, these damages could be triple the
actual damages the patent holder incurs. If we have supplied infringing
products to third parties for marketing or licensed third parties to
manufacture, use or market infringing products, we may be obligated to
indemnify these third parties for any damages they may be required to pay to
the patent holder and for any losses the third parties may sustain themselves
as the result of lost sales or damages paid to the patent holder.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If a
third party holding rights under a patent successfully asserts an infringement
claim with respect to any of our products, we may be prevented from
manufacturing or marketing our infringing product in the country or countries
covered by the patent we infringe, unless we can obtain a license from the
patent holder. Any required license may not be available to us on acceptable
terms, or at all. Some licenses may be non-exclusive, and therefore, our
competitors may have access to the same technology licensed to us. If we fail
to obtain a required license or are unable to design around a patent, we may be
unable to market some of our products, which could have a material adverse
effect on our business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our warranty reserves may not
adequately cover our warranty obligations.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We
have established reserves for the estimated liability associated with our
product warranties.&#160; However, we could
experience unforeseen circumstances where these or future reserves may not
adequately cover our warranty obligations.&#160;
For example, the failure or inadequate performance of product components
that we purchase could increase our warranty obligations beyond these reserves.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our success
depends on our ability to attract, retain and motivate our executives and other
key personnel.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our
future success depends in large part on our ability to attract, retain and
motivate our executives and other key personnel, many of whom have been
instrumental in developing new technologies and setting strategic plans.&#160; Our growth also depends in large part on our
continuing ability to hire, motivate and retain highly qualified management,
technical, sales and marketing team members. Competition for qualified
personnel is intense and there can be no assurance that we will retain existing
personnel or attract additional qualified personnel in the future.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Changes in stock option accounting rules&nbsp;may
adversely impact our reported operating results prepared in accordance with
generally accepted accounting principles, our stock price and our competitiveness
in the employee marketplace.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Technology
companies in general and our company in particular have a history of depending
upon and using broad based employee stock option programs to hire, incentivize
and retain employees in a competitive marketplace. For fiscal years 2005, 2004
and 2003, we did not recognize compensation expense for stock options issued to
employees or directors, except in limited cases involving modifications of
stock options, and we instead disclosed in the notes to our financial statements
information about what such charges would be if they were expensed.&#160; Beginning with the first quarter of fiscal
2006, we have adopted SFAS No.&nbsp;123(R), which will require us to record
equity-based compensation expense for stock options and employee stock purchase
plan rights granted to employees based on the fair value of the equity
instrument at the time of grant. The change in accounting rules&nbsp;will lead
to a decrease in reported earnings or an increase in reported net loss, as the
case may be. This may negatively impact our future stock price. In addition,
this change in accounting rules&nbsp;could impact our ability to utilize broad
based employee stock plans to reward employees and could result in a
competitive disadvantage to us in the employee marketplace.&#160; See Note 1, &#147;Operations and Summary of
Significant Accounting Policies - Stock Based Compensation, of Notes to
Consolidated Financial Statements&#148; for more information concerning our adoption
of this accounting standard.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 2. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Properties</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We own no real property and we currently lease all
facilities used in our business. Our headquarters are located in San Diego,
California in a two-building light industrial complex comprising approximately
160,000 square feet. The lease expires in February&nbsp;2014 and can be renewed
for one additional five-year period. This San Diego facility houses all of our
research and development, and administrative functions, &#160;as well as a major portion of sales, sales
administration, marketing and customer support.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We lease a 17,000 square foot facility located in
Wokingham, England, which houses sales, technical support and repair services.
The lease expires in January&nbsp;2018. We also maintain small sales offices
located close to Paris, France, Munich, Germany, Singapore and Korea.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are obligated under a lease on a 15,000 square foot
facility in Longmont, Colorado which was used by an operation we shut down in
2001. The facility is currently vacant and the lease expires in November&nbsp;2005.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 3. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Legal Proceedings</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are
from time to time involved in various lawsuits and legal proceedings that arise
in the ordinary course of business. &#160;We
are currently not aware of any such legal proceedings or claims that we believe
will have, individually or in the aggregate, a material adverse affect on our
business, financial condition or operating results. &#160;However, litigation is subject to inherent
uncertainties, and an adverse result in these or other matters may arise from
time to time that may harm our business.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 4. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\byang\05-16127-1\task577732\16127-1-ba-01.htm',USER='byang',CD='Sep 15 00:27 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART&nbsp;II</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 5. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Market for Registrant&#146;s Common Equity and Related Shareholder Matters</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
common stock trades on The NASDAQ National Market under the symbol &#147;OVRL&#148;. As
of September&nbsp;7, 2005, there were approximately 133 shareholders of record.
We have not paid any cash dividends on our common stock and do not anticipate
paying any cash dividends in the foreseeable future. The high and low bid
quotations of our common stock from June&nbsp;29, 2003 through July&nbsp;3, 2005
were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="50%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:50.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="60%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.32%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.88%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="35%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:35.6%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
above quotations reflect inter-dealer prices, without retail markup, markdown
or commission and may not necessarily represent actual transactions.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Share
Repurchase Authorization</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;11,
2004, our board of directors authorized the purchase of up to $10.0 million of
our common stock on the open market or through negotiated transactions. This
repurchase authority allows us to selectively repurchase our common stock from
time to time in the open market or in privately negotiated transactions
depending on market price and other factors. The share repurchase authorization has no stated expiration
date. During the fourth quarter of fiscal 2005, 32,500 shares were repurchased under
the repurchase authorization as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ISSUER PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES</font></b></h3>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 6. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Selected Financial Data</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following selected financial data has been derived from our audited
consolidated financial statements and the related notes. This information
should be read in conjunction with Item 7 of this Report - &#147;Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations,&#148; and
with our consolidated financial statements and the related notes set forth at
the pages&nbsp;indicated in Item 15(a)(1)&nbsp;of this Report.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.0%;">
