<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Agreement) to the
aggregate amount of such Losses pursuant to the terms of the Escrow Agreement,
and such recovery shall be made from the Escrow Fund.&#160; As set forth in the Escrow Agreement and
subject to Section&nbsp;7.10, the Indemnifying Parties (other than the Key
Stockholder) shall have no liability for Losses in excess of the Escrow Fund
held under the Escrow Agreement; provided, however, that each Equity Holder
shall be liable for Losses up to the total value of the Equity Consideration
received by </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">such Equity Holder for any breach by such Equity
Holder of the representations set forth in Section&nbsp;3.34 of this
Agreement.&#160; The Key Stockholder shall be
liable for Losses but only up to the total value of the Stock Consideration
received by the Key Stockholder, determined as of the Closing Date.&#160; Any and all Losses incurred by an Indemnified
Party shall first be recovered from the Escrow Fund to the extent Escrow Cash
remains available.&#160; Notwithstanding any
other provision set forth herein, in the event of a breach of Section&nbsp;3.34
of this Agreement by an Equity Holder, the Indemnified Party shall be entitled
to recover the full amount of such Losses from the portion of the Escrow Cash
that may be distributable on the Termination Date to the breaching Equity
Holder, and if such amount is insufficient to cover all of such Losses: (i)&nbsp;from
the remainder of the Escrow Cash that may be distributable on the Termination
Date to all other Indemnifying Parties if the breaching Equity Holder has not
signed this Agreement (either personally or through Ganapathy Krishnan as its
attorney in fact), and (ii)&nbsp;only from the breaching Equity Holder up to
the total value of such Equity Holder&#146;s Equity Consideration if it has signed
this Agreement (either personally or through Ganapathy Krishnan as its attorney
in fact).</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Subject to Section&nbsp;7.8 and any
claim based on the enumerated representations set forth in Section&nbsp;7.1(a),
no claim for indemnification hereunder or otherwise with respect to a breach of
this Agreement may be made by any Indemnified Party after the Termination Date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section7_4__082108"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;7.4.
<u>Indemnification Procedures.</u>&#160; All
claims for indemnification under this ARTICLE&nbsp;VII shall be asserted and
resolved as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Third-Party Claims</u>.&#160; In the event any Indemnified Party becomes
aware of a third-party claim that Parent believes may result in a demand
against the Escrow Fund or otherwise, Parent shall notify the Stockholder Agent
of such claim, and the Stockholder Agent, as representative for the
Indemnifying Parties, shall be entitled, at its expense, to participate in, but
not to determine or conduct, the defense of such claim.&#160; The Indemnified Parties shall have the right
in their sole discretion to conduct the defense of and settle any such claim;
provided, however, that except with the written consent of the Stockholder
Agent, no settlement of any such claim with third-party claimants shall alone
be determinative of the amount of Losses relating to such matter (and any
dispute related thereto shall be resolved pursuant to the dispute resolution
procedures described in Section&nbsp;7.4(b)&nbsp;and Section&nbsp;7.6).&#160; In the event that the Stockholder Agent has
consented to any such settlement, neither the Stockholder Agent nor any of the
Indemnifying Parties, shall have the power or authority to object to the amount
of any claim by any Indemnified Party against the Escrow Fund or otherwise with
respect to such settlement.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Non-Third Party Claims</u>.&#160; In the event an Indemnified Party has a claim
hereunder that does not involve a claim being asserted against or sought to be
collected by a third party, the Indemnified Party shall with reasonable
promptness send a Claim Notice with respect</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='46',FILE='C:\JMS\mugovind\05-16127-1\task577603\16127-1-kc-03.htm',USER='mgovindaraj',CD='Sep 15 09:52 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">to such claim to the
Stockholder Agent and, if the Indemnified Party intends to make a claim against
the Escrow Fund, to the Escrow Agent.&#160; If
the Stockholder Agent does not notify the Indemnified Party within thirty (30)
calendar days from the date of receipt of such Claim Notice that indemnifying
party disputes such claim, the amount of such claim shall be conclusively deemed
a liability of the indemnifying party hereunder.&#160; In case the Stockholder Agent shall object in
writing to any claim made in accordance with this Section&nbsp;7.4(b), the
Indemnified Party shall have fifteen (15) calendar days to respond in a written
statement to the objection of the Stockholder Agent.&#160; If after such fifteen (15) calendar day
period there remains a dispute as to any claim, the parties shall attempt in
good faith for sixty (60) calendar days to agree upon the rights of the
respective parties with respect to each of such claims.&#160; If the parties should so agree, a memorandum
setting forth such agreement shall be prepared and signed by both parties.&#160; If the parties do not so agree, the parties
shall resolve such dispute pursuant to Section&nbsp;7.6.&#160; If the Indemnified Party is making a claim
against the Escrow Fund, the Escrow Agent shall refrain from disbursing any
portion of the Escrow Fund until resolution of such dispute pursuant to Section&nbsp;7.6.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; An Indemnified Party&#146;s failure to
give reasonably prompt notice to the indemnifying party of any actual,
threatened or possible claim or demand which may give rise to a right of
indemnification hereunder shall not relieve the indemnifying party of any
liability which the indemnifying party may have to the Indemnified Party unless
the failure to give such notice materially and adversely prejudiced the
indemnifying party.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section7_5_StockholderAgent__082111"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;7.5. <u>Stockholder Agent.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Each of the Indemnifying Parties has
irrevocably appointed and constituted the Stockholder Agent as their agent and
attorney-in-fact to do the following: (i)&nbsp;with respect to all Indemnifying
Parties (including the Key Stockholder), to give and receive notices and
communications, to agree to, negotiate, enter into settlements and compromises
of, and demand arbitration and comply with orders of courts and awards of
arbitrators with respect to claims made under this ARTICLE&nbsp;VII, and to
take all actions necessary or appropriate in the judgment of the Stockholder
Agent for the accomplishment of the foregoing, and (ii)&nbsp;with respect to
Indemnifying Parties other than the Key Stockholder, to sign this Agreement and
to agree to the transactions contemplated thereby, including, without
limitation, the deposit of the Escrow Cash into the Escrow Fund, the use of the
Escrow Cash as collateral to secure the rights of the Indemnified Parties under
this ARTICLE&nbsp;VII in the manner set forth herein and in the Escrow
Agreement, the deposit of the Expense Cash into the Expense Fund and the use of
the Expense Cash to pay all out of pocket expenses reasonably incurred by the
Stockholder Agent in the performance of its duties hereunder.&#160; Such agency may be changed (whether pursuant
to vacancy, removal or resignation) by the vote of a majority of the
Indemnifying Parties from time to time upon not less than thirty (30) calendar
days prior written notice to Parent, except for the agency described in clause (ii)&nbsp;in
the preceding sentence, which may not be changed after the Closing Date.&#160; No bond shall be required of the Stockholder
Agent, and the Stockholder Agent shall receive no compensation for its
services, except for (x) payment by the Indemnifying Parties of expenses,
including fees of counsel, reasonably incurred by the Stockholder Agent in
connection with the performance of its duties hereunder and (y) payment of any
interest that accrues on the Escrow Cash and the Expense Cash during the Escrow
Period and that is available for distribution to the Stockholder Agent at the
end of the Escrow Period, pursuant to the terms</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='47',FILE='C:\JMS\mugovind\05-16127-1\task577603\16127-1-kc-03.htm',USER='mgovindaraj',CD='Sep 15 09:52 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of the Escrow
Agreement.&#160; Such expenses may be paid by
the Indemnifying Parties out of (i)&nbsp;the Expense Fund at any time, solely
at the discretion of the Stockholder Agent or (ii)&nbsp;the Escrow Fund, in
full or in part, only after the Termination Date and only if Escrow Cash not
subject to any Claim Notice exists in the Escrow Fund at that time to cover
such payment.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Stockholder Agent shall not be
liable for any act done or omitted hereunder as Stockholder Agent while acting
in good faith, and any act done or omitted pursuant to the advice of counsel
shall be conclusive evidence of such good faith.&#160; The Indemnifying Parties shall severally
indemnify the Stockholder Agent and hold such agent harmless against any loss,
liability or expense incurred without bad faith on the part of the Stockholder
Agent and arising out of or in connection with the acceptance or administration
of the Stockholder Agent&#146;s duties hereunder.&#160;
The Stockholder Agent may recover from the Expense Fund, all reasonable
costs and expenses incurred by the Stockholder Agent in connection with the
performance of his duties set forth in this Agreement.&#160; If the Stockholder Agent incurs fees and
expenses in excess of the Expense Fund, the Indemnifying Parties agree to pay
all amounts requested by the Stockholder Agent within five (5)&nbsp;days of any
such request.&#160; Any such additional
amounts in excess of the Expense Fund must be approved by the Indemnifying
Parties representing a majority in interest of the Escrow Fund and shall be
allocable among (and shall be paid by) the Indemnifying Parties based on their
respective pro rata portions of the Expense Fund.&#160; Subject to the prior right of the Parent to
make claims for damages (including the limitations set forth in Section&nbsp;7.5(a)&nbsp;above),
the Stockholder Agent, with the consent of the Indemnifying Parties entitled to
a majority in interest in the Escrow Fund, may recover from the Escrow Fund
prior to any payment to the Indemnifying Parties, reasonable costs and expenses
incurred by the Stockholder Agent in excess of the Expense Fund and in
connection with the performance of his duties set forth in this Agreement.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; A decision, act, consent or
instruction of the Stockholder Agent shall constitute a decision of all
Indemnifying Parties, and shall be final, binding and conclusive upon each
Equity Holder, and Parent may rely upon any decision, act, consent or
instruction of the Stockholder Agent taken in such manner as being the
decision, act, consent or instruction of each and every Equity Holder.&#160; Parent is hereby relieved from any liability
to any person for any acts done by them in accordance with such decision, act,
consent or instruction of the Stockholder Agent.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section7_6_ResolutionOfConflicts__082113"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;7.6. <u>Resolution of Conflicts.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Arbitration</u>.&#160; If no agreement can be reached after good
faith negotiation between the parties pursuant to Section&nbsp;7.4(b), either
the Indemnified Party or the Stockholder Agent may, by written notice to the
other, demand arbitration of the matter, which arbitration shall be conducted
by a single arbitrator.&#160; The Indemnified
Party and the Stockholder Agent shall agree on the arbitrator, provided that if
the Indemnified Party and the Stockholder Agent cannot agree on such
arbitrator, either the Indemnified Party or the Stockholder Agent can request
that Judicial Arbitration and Mediation Services (&#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">JAMS</font></b>&#148;)
select the arbitrator.&#160; The arbitrator
shall set a limited time period and establish procedures designed to reduce the
cost and time for discovery while allowing the parties an opportunity, adequate
in the sole judgment of the arbitrator, to discover relevant information from
the opposing parties about the subject matter of the dispute.&#160; The arbitrator shall rule&nbsp;upon motions
to compel or limit discovery and shall have</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='48',FILE='C:\JMS\mugovind\05-16127-1\task577603\16127-1-kc-03.htm',USER='mgovindaraj',CD='Sep 15 09:52 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the authority to impose
sanctions, including attorneys&#146; fees and costs, to the same extent as a court
of competent law or equity, should the arbitrator determine that discovery was
sought without substantial justification or that discovery was refused or
objected to without substantial justification.&#160;
The decision of the arbitrator shall be written, shall be in accordance
with applicable Law and with this Agreement, and shall be supported by written
findings of fact and conclusion of law, which shall set forth the basis for the
decision of the arbitrator.&#160; The decision
of the arbitrator as to the validity and amount of any claim in a Claim Notice
shall be binding and conclusive upon the parties, and notwithstanding any other
provision of this ARTICLE&nbsp;VII, the Escrow Agent, if applicable, and the
parties shall be entitled to act in accordance with such decision and the
Escrow Agent, if applicable, shall be entitled to make or withhold payments out
of the Escrow Fund in accordance therewith.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Judgment; Arbitration
Expenses</font></u><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Judgment upon any award rendered by the
arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.&#160; Any such arbitration shall be held in San
Diego, California under the commercial rules&nbsp;then in effect for JAMS.&#160; The non-prevailing party to an arbitration
shall pay its own expenses, the fees of the arbitrator, any administrative fee
of JAMS, and the expenses, including attorneys&#146; fees and costs, reasonably
incurred by the other Parties to the arbitration.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section7_7_NoContributi_082116"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;7.7.
<u>No Contribution.</u>&#160; The Stockholder
Agent waives, and acknowledges and agrees that it shall not, on behalf of the
Indemnifying Parties, or otherwise, have and shall not exercise or assert (or
attempt to exercise or assert), any right of contribution, right of indemnity
or other right or remedy against the Surviving Corporation in connection with
any indemnification or other rights any Indemnified Party may have under or in
connection with this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section7_8__082119"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;7.8.
<u>Fraud; Willful Misrepresentation.</u>&#160;
Notwithstanding any provision in this Agreement to the contrary, the
liability of any Equity Holder (other than the Key Stockholder) for fraud or
willful misrepresentation on the part of such Equity Holder shall not be
limited as set forth above, and any claim with respect to such liability need
not be presented within the time limits set forth in Section&nbsp;7.1(a)&nbsp;and
shall be subject only to applicable statutes of limitation.&#160; Notwithstanding any provision in this Agreement
to the contrary, the liability of the Key Stockholder for fraud or willful
misrepresentation on the part of the Key Stockholder shall not be limited as
set forth above, and any claim with respect to such liability need not be
presented within the time limits set forth in Section&nbsp;7.1(a)&nbsp;and
shall be subject only to applicable statutes of limitation.&#160; For purposes of this Agreement, any breach of
the representations set forth in Section&nbsp;3.17(l) of this Agreement that
are qualified by &#147;Actual Knowledge&#148; shall be deemed a willful
misrepresentation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section7_9__082121"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;7.9.
<u>Remedies Cumulative.</u>&#160; Subject to
the limitations and qualifications set forth in this ARTICLE&nbsp;VII, the
remedies provided herein shall be cumulative and shall not preclude the
assertion by the parties hereto of any other rights or the seeking of any other
remedies under applicable law (including rescission in the event of fraud)
against the other parties, or their respective successors or assigns.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section7_10__082123"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;7.10.
<u>Purchase Price Adjustment.</u>&#160; Any
payments made pursuant to this ARTICLE&nbsp;VII shall be treated for tax
purposes as an adjustment to the Purchase Price.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="Articleviii_082126"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ARTICLE&nbsp;VIII<br>
<u>POST-CLOSING COVENANTS</u></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section8_1__082149"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;8.1.
<u>Company Intellectual Property.</u>&#160;
Each of the Equity Holders and Special Payees agrees that, from and
after the Closing Date, it shall not, and it shall cause its Representatives
not to, use any of the Intellectual Property of the Company (other than
pursuant to a written agreement with the Company).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section8_2_082151"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;8.2.
<u>Cooperation.</u>&#160; After the Closing
Date, upon the request of Parent, the Company and the Key Stockholder shall: (i)&nbsp;execute
and deliver any and all further materials, documents and instruments of
conveyance, transfer or assignment as may reasonably be requested by the
Company or Merger Sub to effect, record or verify the transfer to and vesting
in Parent, Merger Sub and the Surviving Corporation of the Company&#146;s right,
title and interest in and to any Property of the Company, free and clear of all
Encumbrances, in accordance with the terms of this Agreement; and (ii)&nbsp;cooperate
with Parent and Merger Sub to enforce the terms of any Contracts, including
terms relating to confidentiality and Intellectual Property, and to contest or
defend against any Action relating to the Transactions or to the operation of
the Company&#146;s business before the Closing Date.&#160;
After the Closing Date, the Key Stockholder shall: (a)&nbsp;cooperate
with the Company and Parent in their efforts to continue and maintain after the
Effective Time for the benefit of Parent those business relationships of the
Company existing prior to the Closing Date; (b)&nbsp;refer to Parent all
inquiries relating to the Company; and (c)&nbsp;promptly deliver to the Company
(i)&nbsp;any mail, packages and other communications addressed to the Company
and (ii)&nbsp;any cash or other property that Key Stockholder receives and that
properly belongs to Parent or Merger Sub, including any insurance proceeds,
payments with respect to receivables, and interest payable thereon. &#160;The Key Stockholder shall not, and shall cause
his Representatives (if applicable) not to, take any action that would tend to
interfere with the business of Parent, the Company or Merger Sub after the
Closing Date, including disparaging the name or business of Parent, the Company
or Merger Sub.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section8_3__082154"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;8.3.
<u>Non-Disclosure and Non-Compete.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Definitions</u>.&#160; For all purposes of this Section&nbsp;8.3
only, the following terms shall have the following respective meanings:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Noncompetition
Period</font></b>&#148; means the period commencing with the Closing Date and ending
on the second anniversary of the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Competitive Activity</font></b>&#148;
means directly or indirectly (or having any interest in, or performing any
services for, any Person directly or indirectly): (i)&nbsp;engaging in any
activity that is the same as, similar to, or competitive with the business of
the Company or Surviving Corporation; (ii)&nbsp;engaging in the development or
distribution of any product that is the same as, similar to, or competitive
with any Company Products or other products being developed, distributed, sold,
licensed, leased or delivered by the Company or Parent or its Subsidiaries,
including the Surviving Corporation, during the Noncompetition Period; (iii)&nbsp;soliciting
for employment or recommending for employment any Person then employed by or
consulting for Parent or any Affiliate of Parent during such Person&#146;s
employment with or consultancy for Parent or any Affiliate of Parent or for two
(2)&nbsp;years thereafter; or (iv)&nbsp;diverting</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='50',FILE='C:\JMS\mugovind\05-16127-1\task577603\16127-1-kc-03.htm',USER='mgovindaraj',CD='Sep 15 09:52 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">or attempting to divert
from Parent or any Affiliate of Parent any business of any kind in which they
are engaged or are proposed to be engaged, including the solicitation of or
interference with any suppliers, contractors, or customers.&#160; The term &#147;Competitive Activity&#148; shall not
include the ownership of up to one percent (1%), on a fully-diluted basis, of
the total shares of all classes of stock outstanding of any Entity having
securities listed on a national securities exchange registered under Section&nbsp;6
of the Exchange Act, or traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market National Market
System.&#160; The term &#147;Competitive Activity&#148;
shall not include any activities conducted on behalf of Parent or the Surviving
Corporation by the Key Stockholder in connection with his employment by Parent
or the Surviving Corporation.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Confidential Information</font></b>&#148;
means all Trade Secrets and other confidential or proprietary information of
the Company, including information derived from reports, investigations,
research, work in progress, codes, marketing and sales programs, financial
projections, cost summaries, pricing formula, contract analyses, financial
information, projections, confidential filings with any Governmental Body, and
all other confidential concepts, methods of doing business, ideas, materials or
information prepared or performed for, by or on behalf of such Person by its
employees, officers, directors, agents, representatives, or consultants;
provided that information shall not be deemed Confidential Information if: (i)&nbsp;such
information becomes available to or known by the public generally through no
fault of the Company or an Equity Holder; or (ii)&nbsp;disclosure is required
by law or the Order of any Governmental Body under color of law, provided,
however, that prior to disclosing any information pursuant to this clause (ii),
the Company or the applicable Equity Holder shall, if possible, give prior
written notice thereof to Parent and, at Parent&#146;s election, either provide
Parent with the opportunity to contest such disclosure or seek to obtain a
protective order narrowing the scope of such disclosure or use of the
Confidential Information.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iv)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Restricted Territory</font></b>&#148;
means every state, territory, country or jurisdiction in which the Company has
carried on business prior to the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Key Stockholder agrees that, for
and in consideration of the Merger, during the Noncompetition Period, he shall
not engage in any Competitive Activity in the Restricted Territory.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; It is the understanding of the
Parties that the scope of the covenants contained in this Section&nbsp;8.3,
both as to time and area covered, are necessary to protect the rights of Parent
and the goodwill that is a part of the Company to be acquired by Parent and Merger
Sub.&#160; It is the Parties&#146; intention that
these covenants be enforced to the greatest extent (but to no greater extent)
in time, area, and degree of participation as is permitted by the law of that
jurisdiction whose law is found to be applicable to any acts in breach of these
covenants.&#160; It being the purpose of this
Agreement to govern competition by the Key Stockholder in the Restricted
Territory, these covenants shall be governed by and construed according to that
law (from among those jurisdictions arguably applicable to this Agreement and
those in which a breach of this Agreement is alleged to have occurred or to be
threatened) that best gives them effect.&#160;
The prohibitions in Section&nbsp;8.3(b)&nbsp;shall be deemed, and shall
be construed as, separate and independent agreements between Parent and Merger
Sub on the one hand, and the Key Stockholder, on the other.&#160; If any such agreement or any part of such
agreement is held invalid, void or unenforceable by any court of competent
jurisdiction, such invalidity, voidness, or</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">51</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='51',FILE='C:\JMS\mugovind\05-16127-1\task577603\16127-1-kc-03.htm',USER='mgovindaraj',CD='Sep 15 09:52 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">unenforceability shall in
no way render invalid, void, or unenforceable any other part thereof or any
separate agreement not declared invalid, void or unenforceable; and this
Agreement shall in such case be construed as if the invalid, void, or
unenforceable provisions were omitted.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Parties agree that the covenants
of the Key Stockholder not to compete contained in this Section&nbsp;8.3 may be
assigned by Parent or Merger Sub to any Person to whom may be transferred the
business of the Surviving Corporation or any portion thereof after the
Effective Time.&#160; It is the Parties&#146;
intention that these covenants of the Key Stockholder shall inure to the
benefit of any Person that may succeed to the Company or its business or any
portion thereof with the same force and effect as if these covenants were made
directly with such successor.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; After the Closing Date, except as may
be required for tax purposes or other regulatory purposes, neither the Equity
Holders, the Special Payees nor any of their respective successors, heirs,
assigns or Representatives, as applicable, shall: (a)&nbsp;retain any document,
databases or other media embodying any Confidential Information of the Company
or reproduce, use, publish or disclose to any third person any Confidential
Information; or (b)&nbsp;reproduce, use, publish or disclose any Confidential
Information concerning Parent or its Affiliates.&#160; In the event of any termination of this
Agreement: (i)&nbsp;each Equity Holder and Special Payee shall treat as
confidential and proprietary and shall not disclose or use, directly or
indirectly, in any manner whatsoever, or permit others under its control to
disclose or to use, any information concerning Parent or any Affiliate of Parent
or their respective businesses or products obtained pursuant to or in
connection with this Agreement or the Merger or which are the subject matter of
this Agreement, unless such information is or becomes a matter of public
knowledge through no fault of such Equity Holder or Special Payee or can be
shown to have been in the possession of such Equity Holder or Special Payee
prior to disclosure by Parent or an Affiliate of Parent; and (ii)&nbsp;each
Equity Holder and Special Payee shall promptly return to Parent upon written
request all written information and documents received from Parent or any
Affiliate of Parent or any of their respective Representatives, in connection
with the Merger, including all copies thereof and excerpts therefrom, (iii)&nbsp;Parent
shall treat as confidential and proprietary and shall not disclose or use,
directly or indirectly, in any manner whatsoever, or permit others under its
control to disclose or to use, any information concerning Company or its
businesses or products obtained pursuant to or in connection with this
Agreement or the Merger or which are the subject matter of this Agreement,
unless such information is or becomes a matter of public knowledge through no
fault of Parent or can be shown to have been in the possession of Parent prior
to disclosure by Company; and (iv)&nbsp;Parent shall promptly return to Company
upon written request all written information and documents received from
Company or any of its Representatives, in connection with the Merger, including
all copies thereof and excerpts therefrom.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Parties agree that, in the event
of breach or threatened breach of the covenants in this Section&nbsp;8.3, the
damage or imminent damage to the value and the goodwill of the non-breaching
party will be irreparable and extremely difficult to estimate, making any
remedy at law or in damages inadequate.&#160;
Accordingly, the Parties agree that the non-breaching party shall be
entitled to injunctive relief against the breaching party, in the event of any
breach or threatened breach of any of such covenants by such breaching party,
in addition to any other</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">52</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='52',FILE='C:\JMS\mugovind\05-16127-1\task577603\16127-1-kc-03.htm',USER='mgovindaraj',CD='Sep 15 09:52 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">relief (including
damages) available to the non-breaching party under this Agreement or under
applicable law.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section8_4_EmployeesEmployeeBenef_082206"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;8.4. <u>Employees; Employee Benefits</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Subject to applicable law, on and
after the Closing, to the extent practicable, Parent shall provide each
Transferred Employee credit with respect to each employee benefit plan of
Parent in which such Transferred Employee participates, for service prior to
the Closing Date with the Company, for purposes of determining eligibility and
vesting and for any other purpose for which such service is currently
recognized under a comparable Company employee benefit plan for such purpose; provided,
however, such service need not be credited to the extent it would result in a
duplication of benefits, including benefit accrual under defined benefit plans
or determination of level of benefits.&#160;
Such service also shall apply, to the extent practicable, for purposes
of satisfying any waiting periods, evidence of insurability requirements, or
the application of any preexisting condition limitations applicable under any
employee benefit plans of Parent in which such Transferred Employee participates.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; If any Transferred Employee is
discharged by Parent after (but not prior to) the Closing, then Parent shall be
responsible for any and all severance costs for such Transferred Employee, to
the extent such payments are owing under those agreements, plans or
arrangements listed in the Disclosure Schedules, all liability for all notices
or payments due to any Transferred Employee after the Closing pursuant to any
agreements, the WARN Act or Applicable Law, and under any arrangements provided
by Parent to such Transferred Employee.&#160;
The Company shall be responsible and assumes all liabilities for any and
all severance costs, notices and payments including, but not limited to wages,
vacation pay and reimbursement earned through the Closing Date due to any employees
of the Company terminated, or given notice of termination, prior to the
Closing, pursuant to any agreements, plans or arrangements, the WARN Act or
other Applicable Law.&#160; All payments and
obligations of the Company due and owing prior to the Closing Date shall be
paid or fulfilled by the Company prior to the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Company shall provide to Parent such
information necessary or appropriate for Parent to provide benefits to
Transferred Employees pursuant to this Section&nbsp;8.4, including, but not
limited to, confirmation of a Transferred Employee&#146;s termination of employment
from Company.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Company will pay, prior to the
Closing Date, all applicable premiums for all compensation and employee
benefits due before the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section8_5_Ind_082210"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;8.5.
<u>Indemnification of Directors and Officers</u>.&#160; Parent will, and will cause the Surviving
Corporation to ensure that the Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the
Surviving Corporation contain provisions with respect to indemnification of
directors and officers whereby directors and officers will be indemnified by
the Surviving Corporation to the fullest extent permissible by applicable
law.&#160; Such provisions shall not be
amended, repealed or otherwise modified in any manner that would adversely
affect the rights thereunder of individuals who, immediately prior to the
Effective Time, were directors and officers of the Company, unless such
modification is required by law.&#160; Parent
will cause the Surviving</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">53</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporation to honor and
fulfill the obligations of the Company pursuant to any indemnification
agreements, as currently in effect, between the Company and its officers and
directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section8_6__082232"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;8.6.
<u>Attorney-Client Privilege and Legal Files</u>. Parent and Merger Sub
acknowledge and agree that, effective upon the Effective Time, (i)&nbsp;the
attorney-client privilege regarding this Agreement and all transactions
contemplated hereby shall not continue as the privilege of the Surviving
Corporation but instead shall be the sole privilege of the Equity Holders
acting through the Stockholder Agent; and (b)&nbsp;all files of counsel to the
Company regarding the transactions contemplated by this Agreement (including
preparations in contemplation of such transactions) shall become the property
of the Equity Holders acting through the Stockholder Agent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="Articleix_082235"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ARTICLE&nbsp;IX<br>
<u>EMPLOYEES</u></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section9_1_Tra_082237"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;9.1.
<u>Transferred Employees.</u>&#160; Parent or
Merger Sub may, but shall have no obligation to, offer employment, to be
effective as of the Closing Date and contingent upon the closing of the Merger,
on terms to be determined by Parent, to those employees of the Company who are
listed on Schedule&nbsp;9.1 (collectively, the &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Transferred
Employees</font></b>&#148;).&#160; The Company
shall terminate the employment, to be effective as of the Closing Date, of any
employees of the Company who are not Transferred Employees.&#160; The Parties acknowledge and agree that it is
not the intention of the Parties that any contracts of employment of any
employees of the Company shall be assumed by Parent or Merger Sub, or be
binding upon the Surviving Corporation, as a result of the Merger.&#160; The Company shall use its best efforts to (i)&nbsp;encourage
the Transferred Employees to continue their employment with the Company until
the Closing Date and thereupon to accept employment with Parent or Merger Sub,
and (ii)&nbsp;assist Parent or Merger Sub in employing Transferred Employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section9_2_Em_082239"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;9.2.
<u>Employee Benefit Arrangements.</u>&#160; In
order to secure an orderly and effective transition of the employee benefit
arrangements for Transferred Employees and their respective beneficiaries and
dependents, the Company and the Key Stockholder shall cooperate, both before
and after the Closing Date, with Parent to (i)&nbsp;provide to Parent
information related to the Transferred Employees, including employment records,
benefits information, and financial statements, and (ii)&nbsp;take any other
actions requested by Parent or the Surviving Corporation with respect to the
Transferred Employees and their respective beneficiaries and dependents.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section9_3_C_082241"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;9.3.
<u>Compliance with Applicable Law and Other Obligations.</u>&#160; Prior to the Closing Date, at its sole cost
and expense, the Company shall take all actions necessary to comply with any
applicable Law in connection with the Company&#146;s employment of its employees,
including the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act of 1988, as
amended (the &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">WARN Act</font></b>&#148;).&#160; The Company shall be solely responsible,
before and after the Closing Date, for the payment of any amounts required to
be paid under any applicable Law, including the WARN Act and any similar state
laws, as a result of the termination or layoff prior to the Effective Time of
any employee of the Company who is not a Transferred Employee in connection
with the Merger, and the Indemnifying Parties shall indemnify Parent and Merger</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sub for the payment of any such
amounts pursuant to ARTICLE&nbsp;VII.&#160;
Prior to the Closing Date, the Company shall perform all of its
contractual and other obligations in connection with the employment of its
employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section9_4_No_082244"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;9.4.
<u>No Benefit to the Company Employees Intended.</u>&#160; This ARTICLE&nbsp;IX is not intended to, and
does not, create any rights or obligations to or for the benefit of any Person
other than Parent and Merger Sub.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="Articlex_082245"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ARTICLE&nbsp;X<br>
<u>TERMINATION</u></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section10_1_Ci_082247"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;10.1.
<u>Circumstances for Termination.</u>&#160; At
any time prior to the Effective Time, this Agreement may be terminated by
written notice explaining the reason for such termination (without prejudice to
other remedies which may be available to the Parties under this Agreement, at
law or in equity):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; by the mutual written consent of
Parent and the Company;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; by Parent if: (i)&nbsp;the Company or
any of the Key Stockholder is in material breach of any material provision of
this Agreement; and (ii)&nbsp;Parent and Merger Sub are not, on the date of
termination, in material breach of any material provision of this Agreement;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; by the Company if: (i)&nbsp;Parent or
Merger Sub is in material breach of any material provision of this Agreement;
and (ii)&nbsp;the Company and the Key Stockholder are not, on the date of
termination, in material breach of any material provision of this Agreement;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; by either Parent or the Company if: (i)&nbsp;the
closing of the Merger has not occurred on or prior to August&nbsp;31, 2005 for
any reason; and (ii)&nbsp;the terminating Party is not, on the date of
termination, in material breach of any material provision of this Agreement;
and</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; by either Parent or the Company if: (i)&nbsp;satisfaction
of a closing condition of the terminating Party in Article&nbsp;11 is
impossible; and (ii)&nbsp;the terminating Party is not, on the date of
termination, in material breach of any material provision of this Agreement.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section10_2__082250"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;10.2.
<u>Effect of Termination.</u>&#160; If this
Agreement is terminated in accordance with Section&nbsp;10.1, all obligations
of the Parties hereunder shall terminate, except for the obligations set forth
in Article&nbsp;XI and Section&nbsp;8.3(e), as well as the obligations in Section&nbsp;5.4(b)&nbsp;relating
to the Non-Disclosure Agreement dated May&nbsp;4, 2005 between Parent and the
Company; provided, however, that nothing herein shall relieve any Party from
liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants
or agreements set forth in this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="Articlexi_082254"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ARTICLE&nbsp;XI<br>
<u>MISCELLANEOUS</u></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_1__082252"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.1.
<u>Entire Agreement.</u>&#160; This Agreement,
together with the Voting Agreements, the Escrow Agreement, other Exhibits, the
Disclosure Schedules and the Non-Disclosure Agreement between the Company and
Parent dated May&nbsp;4, 2005, and the certificates,</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='55',FILE='C:\JMS\mugovind\05-16127-1\task577603\16127-1-kc-03.htm',USER='mgovindaraj',CD='Sep 15 09:52 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">documents, instruments, and
writings that are delivered pursuant to any of them, together constitute the
entire agreement and understanding of the Parties in respect of its and their
subject matter and supersedes all prior understandings, agreements, or
representations by or among the Parties, written or oral, to the extent they
relate in any way to the subject matter hereof or the transactions contemplated
by this agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_2__082259"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.2.
<u>Parties In Interest.</u>&#160; This Agreement
shall be binding upon and inure solely to the benefit of each Party and its
successors and permitted assigns and nothing in this Agreement, express or
implied, is intended to or shall confer upon any other Person (other than
Parent Indemnified Persons) any rights, benefits or remedies of any nature
whatsoever under or by reason of this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_3__082303"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.3.
<u>Assignment; Amendment.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Assignment.&#160; Without prejudice to Section&nbsp;8.3(d),
neither this Agreement nor any of the rights, interests or obligations
hereunder shall be assigned by operation of Law (including, by merger or
consolidation) or otherwise; provided, however, that prior to the Closing,
Merger Sub, and following the Effective Time, the Surviving Corporation, may
assign, in its sole discretion, any or all of its rights, interests and
obligations under this Agreement to any direct wholly owned Subsidiary of
Parent, but no such assignment shall relieve Parent or Merger Sub of its
obligations hereunder if such assignee does not perform such obligations.&#160; Any assignment in violation of the preceding
sentence shall be null and void and of no force or effect.&#160; Subject to the preceding sentence, this
Agreement will be binding upon, inure to the benefit of, and be enforceable by,
the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Amendment.&#160; Following the Effective Time, the Parties may
amend this Agreement by a written amendment signed by Parent, the Surviving
Corporation and the Stockholder Agent.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_4__082307"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.4.
<u>Notices.</u> &#160;All notices, requests,
instructions or other documents to be given under this Agreement shall be in
writing and shall be deemed given, (i)&nbsp;five business days following
sending by registered or certified mail, postage prepaid, (ii)&nbsp;when sent
if sent by facsimile; provided, however, that the facsimile is promptly
confirmed by telephone confirmation thereof, (iii)&nbsp;when delivered, if
delivered personally to the intended recipient, and (iv)&nbsp;one business day
following sending by overnight delivery via a national courier service, and in
each case, addressed to a party at the following address for such Party:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If to Parent or Merger Sub (or, after consummation of
the Merger, to the Surviving Corporation):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.5in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">OVERLAND STORAGE,
INC.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.5in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Attn: President</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.5in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4820 Overland
Drive</font></p>

92123</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_5_S_082329"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.5.
<u>Specific Performance.</u>&#160; The Parties
agree that irreparable damage would occur in the event that any of the
provisions of this Agreement were not performed in accordance with their
specific terms or were otherwise Breached.&#160;
It is accordingly agreed that the Parties shall be entitled to an
injunction or injunctions to prevent Breaches of this Agreement and to enforce
specifically the terms and provisions of this Agreement, this being in addition
to any other remedy to which they are entitled at Law or in equity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_6_S_082331"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.6.
<u>Submission to Jurisdiction; No Jury Trial.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Submission to Jurisdiction.&#160; Except as set forth in Section&nbsp;7.6, each
Party submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of the federal courts located in
San Diego, California, in any Action arising out of or relating to this
Agreement or the Merger and agrees that all claims in respect of the Action
shall be heard and determined in any such court.&#160; Each Party agrees that a final judgment in
any Action so brought shall be conclusive and may be enforced by Action on the
judgment or in any other manner provided at law or in equity.&#160; Each Party waives any defense of inconvenient
forum to the maintenance of any Action so brought and waives any bond, surety,
or other security that might be required of any other party with respect
thereto.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Waiver of Jury Trial.&#160; THE PARTIES EACH HEREBY AGREE TO WAIVE THEIR
RESPECTIVE RIGHTS TO JURY TRIAL OF ANY DISPUTE BASED UPON OR ARISING OUT OF
THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY OTHER AGREEMENTS RELATING HERETO OR ANY DEALINGS AMONG
THEM RELATING TO THE TRANSACTIONS.&#160; The
scope of this waiver is intended to be all encompassing of any and all Actions
that may be filed in any court and that relate to the subject matter of the
Transactions, including, Contract claims, tort claims, breach of duty claims,
and all other common law and statutory claims.&#160;
The Parties each acknowledge that this waiver is a material inducement
to enter into a business relationship and that they will continue to rely on
the waiver in their related future dealings.&#160;
Each Party further represents and warrants that it has reviewed this
waiver with its legal counsel, and that each knowingly and voluntarily waives
its jury trial rights following consultation with legal counsel.&#160; NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY
HEREIN, THIS WAIVER IS IRREVOCABLE, MEANING THAT IT MAY&nbsp;NOT BE MODIFIED
ORALLY OR IN WRITING, AND THE WAIVER SHALL APPLY TO ANY AMENDMENTS,</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">RENEWALS, SUPPLEMENTS, OR
MODIFICATIONS TO THIS AGREEMENT OR TO ANY OTHER DOCUMENTS OR AGREEMENTS
RELATING HERETO.&#160; In the event of an
Action, this Agreement may be filed as a written consent to trial by a court.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Service of Process.&#160; Any Party may make service on any other Party
by sending or delivering a copy of the process to the Party to be served at the
address and in the manner provided for the giving of notices in Section&nbsp;10.4.&#160; Nothing in this Section&nbsp;10.6(c)&nbsp;shall
affect any Party&#146;s right to bring any Action arising out of or relating to this
Agreement in any other court or to serve legal process in any other manner
permitted at Law or in equity.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_7_Time_082337"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.7.
<u>Time.</u>&#160; Time is of the essence in
the performance of this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_8_C_082339"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.8.
<u>Counterparts.</u>&#160; This Agreement may
be executed in two or more original or facsimile counterparts, each of which
shall be deemed an original but all of which together shall constitute one and
the same instrument.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_9_Gov_082341"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.9.
<u>Governing Law.</u>&#160; This Agreement and
the performance of the Transactions and obligations of the Parties hereunder
shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of
California, without giving effect to any choice of law principles.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_10__082346"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.10.
<u>Expenses.</u>&#160; The Company and the
Stockholder Agent shall be solely responsible for the legal, accounting and
other fees and expenses incurred by the Company in connection with the
preparation, execution and delivery of this Agreement and the consummation of
the Transaction contemplated hereby (&#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Expenses</font></b>&#148;).&#160; Parent and Merger Sub shall be solely
responsible for their respective Expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_11_082349"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.11.
<u>Certain Taxes.</u>&#160; All transfer,
documentary, sales, use, stamp, registration and other such Taxes and fees
(including any penalties and interest) incurred in connection with this
Agreement, if any, shall be paid by the Equity Holders and Special Payees when
due.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><a name="Section11_12__082353"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;11.12.
<u>Extensions; Waiver.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Extension.&#160; At any time following the Effective Time,
Parent and the Surviving Corporation, on the one hand, and the Stockholder
Agent, on the other, to the extent legally allowed, may (i)&nbsp;extend the
time for the performance of any of the obligations of the other of them, (ii)&nbsp;waive
any inaccuracies in the representations and warranties contained herein or in
any certificate, instrument or other document delivered pursuant hereto, or (iii)&nbsp;waive
compliance with any of the agreements contained herein.&#160; Any agreement to any such extension or waiver
shall be valid only if set forth in an instrument in writing signed on behalf
of the Person against which enforcement of such extension or waiver is sought.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Waiver.&#160; No waiver by any Party of any default,
misrepresentation, or Breach hereunder, whether intentional or not, may be
deemed to extend to any prior or subsequent default, misrepresentation, or
Breach hereunder or affect in any way any rights arising because of any prior
or subsequent such occurrence.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>
